benchmark_details.name: Visual Number Benchmark (VisNumBench)
benchmark_details.overview: VisNumBench evaluates the number sense abilities of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) across a wide range of visual numerical tasks, comprising about 1,900 multiple-choice question-answer pairs derived from both synthetic and real-world visual data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the intuitive numerical abilities of MLLMs across various visual numerical tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited performance of even the best MLLMs compared to human levels.

data.source: Images from existing datasets, captured by authors, and generated using a Python program.
data.annotation: Manually designed question-answer pairs based on visual attributes.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on the percentage of correctly answered questions out of the total.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy reflects better number sense abilities of MLLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Humans achieved 95.33% average accuracy on the benchmark.
methodology.validation: Evaluated 17 MLLMs across two datasets (synthetic and real).
